org.gearvrf

Class GVRTexture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRTexture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRAndroidResource.Callback<GVRImage>, GVRAndroidResource.CancelableCallback<GVRImage>, GVRAndroidResource.TextureCallback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRExternalRendererTexture, GVRExternalTexture, GVRRenderTexture, GVRSharedTexture

    public class GVRTexture
extends GVRHybridObject
implements GVRAndroidResource.TextureCallback
    Describes a texture mapped onto a 3D object by a shader.

    A texture is a 2D array of data, usually representing an image, that is provided to the GPU shader at run-time to modify the appearance of rendered objects. Usually it determines the base color of the object. Textures are also used to enhance illumination.

    A texture has two parts - the 2D bitmap data and the texture filtering parameters which determine how the texture is applied. The texture parameters are in a GVRTextureParameters object. The bitmap data is kept in a GVRImage object. There are different types of images depending on the internal data format. Each data format is represented by a different GearVRF class.

    GVRBitmapTexture uncompressed RGB or RGBA bitmap data
    GVRCompressedTexture compressed bitmap data
    GVRCubemapTexture uncompressed cubemap data (6 bitmaps)
    GVRCompressedCubemapTexture compressed cubemmap data (6 compressed bitmaps)
    GVRFloatTexture uncompressed floating point bitmap data

    • Method Detail

      • stillWanted

        public boolean stillWanted(GVRAndroidResource r)
        Description copied from interface: GVRAndroidResource.CancelableCallback
        Do you still want this resource? If the throttler has a thread available, your request will be run right away; this method will not be called. If not, it is enqueued; this method will be called (at least once) before starting to load the resource. If you no longer need it, returning false can save non-trivial amounts of time and memory.
        Specified by:
        stillWanted in interface GVRAndroidResource.CancelableCallback<GVRImage>
        Parameters:
        r - The description of the resource that is about to be loaded
        Returns:
        true to continue loading; false to abort. (Returning false will not call failed().)

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Gets the GPU ID for the texture.

        This function will wait until the texture is ready and loaded into the GPU before returning. It is not efficient but will allow you to wait until a texture has been loaded. The ID it returns is platform-dependent.

        Returns:
        GPU texture ID

      • isAtlasedTexture

        public boolean isAtlasedTexture()
        Inform if the texture is a large image containing "atlas" of sub-images with a list of GVRAtlasInformation necessary to map it to the scene objects.
        Returns:
        True if the texture is a large image containing "atlas", otherwise it returns false.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(GVRImage imageData)
        Changes the image data associated with a GVRTexture. This can be a simple bitmap, a compressed bitmap, a cubemap or a compressed cubemap.
        Parameters:
        imageData - data for the texture as a GVRImate
